Introduction.chapter_title: Fatuma Buys the Cheapest Boda Boda
Introduction.content:
Fatuma wanted to start a boda boda business. She went to Kariakoo and found the cheapest motorcycle in the whole market.

Price: only 800,000 TShs!

The seller smiled too much. That should have been the first warning.

Fatuma paid cash, jumped on, and started the engine.

The motorcycle spoke its very first words:

“Eeeh mama, umenona sana! Sitaki kubeba mafuta mengi!”

Fatuma almost fell off.

Chapter 1.content:
Fatuma put on her helmet and drove to the main road.

A customer stopped her.

Customer: “Bei poa, mama?”

Motorcycle (very loud): “Bei poa?! Bei yako ndiyo haipo poa! Mdomo tu!”

![Customer running away from shouting motorcycle](https://picsum.photos/seed/customer-running-boda/800/600)

The customer ran away. Fatuma wanted to cry.

Chapter 2.chapter_title: The Pikipiki Becomes a Relationship Expert
Chapter 2.content:
Next customer was Fatuma’s ex-boyfriend, Juma.

Juma: “Fatuma, mi bado nakupenda.”

Motorcycle: “Acha uongo! Ulimwaga kwa text message!”

Juma turned red and left.

![Ex-boyfriend embarrassed by motorcycle](https://picsum.photos/seed/ex-boyfriend-red-face/800/600)

Fatuma started to laugh. Maybe this motorcycle was useful after all.

Chapter 3.content:
Traffic police stopped her.

Police: “Helmet iko, leseni iko?”

Motorcycle: “Leseni yako ndiyo imepotea! Unakula rushwa kila siku!”

The policeman dropped his pen and walked away quietly.

![Policeman walking away scared](https://picsum.photos/seed/police-scared-boda/800/600)

Fatuma got a free pass forever.

Chapter 4.content:
Someone recorded everything and posted on TikTok.

Video title: “Pikipiki ya Dar es Salaam inayemtukana kila mtu”

10 million views in two days!

People now stop Fatuma just to hear the motorcycle talk.

![Crowd taking videos of rude motorcycle](https://picsum.photos/seed/crowd-filming-boda/800/600)

Fatuma started charging 2,000 TShs per insult. Business boom!

Chapter 5.chapter_title: The Day It Said I Love You
Chapter 5.content:
One night Fatuma cleaned the motorcycle and said,
“Thank you for making me rich.”

The motorcycle went quiet… then whispered:
“Fatuma… nakupenda. Usiniuze.”

![Motorcycle with heart eyes](https://picsum.photos/seed/boda-heart-eyes/800/600)

Fatuma smiled and replied, “Sitakuuza. We are a team now.”

Conclusion.content:
Today Fatuma is the richest boda boda lady in Dar es Salaam.

She bought the motorcycle a new seat and a small helmet.

They ride together every day.

Sometimes it still shouts at customers… but never at Fatuma.

![Fatuma and her motorcycle smiling together](https://picsum.photos/seed/fatuma-happy-boda/800/600)

The end.
